shortdesc: The $ object provides a number of debugging facilities and informational methods.

property.name: error
property.shortdesc: The most recent run-time error information.

property.name: version
property.shortdesc: The version number of the ExtendScript engine.
property.description: Formatted as a three-part number and description; for example: "3.92.95 &#40;debug)".

property.name: build
property.shortdesc: The ExtendScript build information.

property.name: buildDate
property.shortdesc: The ExtendScript build date.

property.name: global
property.shortdesc: A reference to the global object, which contains the JavaScript global namespace.

property.name: stack
property.shortdesc: The current stack trace.

property.name: level
property.shortdesc: The current debugging level, which enables or disables the JavaScript debugger.
property.description: One of 0 &#40;no debugging), 1 (break on runtime errors), or 2 (full debug mode).

property.name: flags
property.shortdesc: Gets or sets low-level debug output flags.

li: 0x0002 &#40;2): Displays each line with its line number as it is executed.

0x0040 &#40;64): Enables excessive garbage collection. Usually, garbage collection starts when the number of objects has increased by a certain amount since the last garbage collection. This flag causes ExtendScript to garbage collect after almost every statement. This impairs performance severely, but is useful when you suspect that an object gets released too soon.
0x0080 &#40;128): Displays all calls with their arguments and the return value.
0x0200 &#40;512): Enables the localization feature of the toString method. Equivalent to the localize property.

property.name: strict
property.shortdesc: Sets or clears strict mode for object modification.
property.description: When true, any attempt to write to a read-only property causes a runtime error. Some objects do not permit the creation of new properties when true.

property.name: locale
property.shortdesc: Gets or sets the current locale.

property.name: localize
property.shortdesc: Set to true to enable the extended localization features of the built-in toString&#40;) method.

property.name: decimalPoint
property.shortdesc: The character used as the decimal point character in formatted numeric output.

property.name: memCache
property.shortdesc: The ExtendScript memory cache size, in bytes.

property.name: screens
property.shortdesc: An array of objects containing information about the display screens attached to your computer.

property.name: os
property.shortdesc: The current operating system version information.

property.name: fileName
property.shortdesc: The file name of the current script.

property.name: line
property.shortdesc: The current line number of the currently executing script.

property.name: hiresTimer
property.shortdesc: A high-resolution timer, measuring the time in microseconds. The timer starts when ExtendScript isinitialized during the application startup sequence. Every read access resets the timer to Zero.

property.name: engineName
property.shortdesc: The name of the current ExtendScript engine, if set.

property.name: includePath
property.shortdesc: The path for include files for the current script.

method.name: about
method.shortdesc: Shows an About box for the ExtendScript component, and returns the text for the box.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Converts this object to a string.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to print. All arguments are concatenated.

method.name: writeln
method.shortdesc: Prints text to the Console, and adds a newline character.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to print. All arguments are concatenated.

method.name: bp
method.shortdesc: Breaks execution at the current position.

parameter.name: condition
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing a JavaScript statement to be used as a condition. If the statement evaluates to true or nonzero when this point is reached, execution stops.

method.name: getenv
method.shortdesc: Retrieves the value of an environment variable.

method.name: setenv
method.shortdesc: Sets the value of an environment variable.

method.name: sleep
method.shortdesc: Suspends the calling thread for a number of milliseconds.
method.description: During a sleep period, checks at 100 millisecond intervals to see whether the sleep should be terminated. This can happen if there is a break request, or if the script timeout has expired.

method.name: colorPicker
method.shortdesc: Invokes the platform-specific color selection dialog, and returns the selected color.

parameter.name: color
parameter.shortdesc: The color to be preselected in the dialog, as 0xRRGGBB, or -1 for the platform default.

method.name: gc
method.shortdesc: Initiates garbage collection in the ExtendScript engine.
